headline: Wells Fargo exits another consent order. Is asset cap next?
summary: In the megabank's latest sign of progress with regulators, it said that a 7-year-old CFPB order has been terminated.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo exits another consent order. Is asset cap next?
raw.summary: In the megabank's latest sign of progress with regulators, it said that a 7-year-old CFPB order has been terminated.

headline: Wells Fargo Clears Another Hurdle as Investors Track Compliance Cleanup
summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau terminated a WElls Fargo consent order issued in April 2018 for improperly charging some mortgage borrowers and for the way it ran an insurance program for auto loans.  It is the 12th consent order that regulators have closed since 2019.  The CFPB found back in 2018 that Wells Fargo had violated the Consumer Financial Protection Act, and ordered the bank to improve its framework for risk-management compliance.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo Clears Another Hurdle as Investors Track Compliance Cleanup

headline: Wells Fargo clears 12th consent order; 2 remain
summary: The 2018 consent order the CFPB lifted is the bank’s sixth to be resolved this year. The two remaining include the Federal Reserve’s asset cap.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo clears 12th consent order; 2 remain
raw.summary: The 2018 consent order the CFPB lifted is the bank’s sixth to be resolved this year. The two remaining include the Federal Reserve’s asset cap.

headline: Wells Fargo Confirms Termination of 2018 CFPB Compliance Consent Order
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, April 28, 2025--Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) today confirmed that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s (CFPB) 2018 consent order related to the company’s compliance risk management program has terminated. This is the twelfth consent order closed by Wells Fargo’s regulators since 2019 and the sixth since the beginning of the year.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo Confirms Termination of 2018 CFPB Compliance Consent Order

This is the twelfth consent order closed by Wells Fargo’s regulators since 2019 and the sixth since the beginning of the year.
